body: Thanks for the report, it appears you have an encrypted private key using `pbeWithMD5AndDES-CBC`. Could you share how you generated this? (Please do not share the actual key of course)

Here is the command used to generate the key

```openssl genrsa 2048 | openssl pkcs8 -topk8 -v1 PBE-MD5-DES -inform PEM -out <private file key name>.p8```

I do understand this is considered insecure  , but this issue was to see if there is an explicit removal of support for this algorithm, in the latest version , if not could it be fixed if  yes, then can that be added in the changelog

This also popped up for us and broke our [Snowflake connection](https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/key-pair-auth#generate-the-private-key), although I'm not sure the exact command that was used. It worked on `44.0.3`.

@alexscott-ff with the same OID and not a different one? Just want to make sure that if we add this algorithm back that it resolves your issue (although you should separately upgrade the encryption wrapping your key! Single DES with MD5 is not good!)

I was able to independently verify that a key generated with 
```
openssl genrsa 2048 | openssl pkcs8 -topk8 -v2 des3 -inform PEM -out <private_key>.p8
```
works fine with the same version. so specifically an issue with the algorithm

issue.title: SNOW-2110708: cryptography-45.0.2 library is raising ValueError during serialization

labels.name: status-fixed_awaiting_release
labels.description: The issue has been fixed, its PR merged, and now awaiting the next release cycle of the connector.

labels.name: status-triage_done
labels.description: Initial triage done, will be further handled by the driver team

issue.body:
### Python version

3.13

### Operating system and processor architecture

linux

### Installed packages

```python
asn1crypto==1.5.1
boto3==1.38.18
botocore==1.38.18
certifi==2025.4.26
cffi==1.17.1
charset-normalizer==3.4.2
cryptography==45.0.2
filelock==3.18.0
idna==3.10
jmespath==1.0.1
packaging==25.0
platformdirs==4.3.8
pycparser==2.22
PyJWT==2.10.1
pyOpenSSL==25.1.0
python-dateutil==2.9.0.post0
pytz==2025.2
requests==2.32.3
s3transfer==0.12.0
six==1.17.0
snowflake-connector-python==3.15.0
sortedcontainers==2.4.0
tomlkit==0.13.2
typing_extensions==4.13.2
urllib3==2.4.0
```

### What did you do?

```python
installed snowflake connector python and created connection to snowflake
```

### What did you expect to see?

making connection failed, to fix this I changed the version of cryptography to 44.0.3

### Can you set logging to DEBUG and collect the logs?

```bash
import logging
import os

for logger_name in ('snowflake.connector',):
    logger = logging.getLogger(logger_name)
    logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
    ch = logging.StreamHandler()
    ch.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
    ch.setFormatter(logging.Formatter('%(asctime)s - %(threadName)s %(filename)s:%(lineno)d - %(funcName)s() - %(levelname)s - %(message)s'))
    logger.addHandler(ch)
```

body: @reaperhulk I believe so but I'm not sure; I think we're going to "fix forward" and re-generate the key, as you suggest :)

> [@alexscott-ff](https://github.com/alexscott-ff) with the same OID and not a different one? Just want to make sure that if we add this algorithm back that it resolves your issue (although you should separately upgrade the encryption wrapping your key! Single DES with MD5 is not good!)

I work with @alexscott-ff and can confirm both that it's the same OID and that we're upgrading the encryption

Hi all,

Thanks for the reports, we appreciate them! I want to make sure I'm following correctly:

1. Everyone who has hit this error has gotten it with 1.2.840.113549.1.5.3
2. No one is quite sure which tool/command was used to produce their key with it? (I know we can reproduce it with `-v1 PBE-MD5-DES`, but it sounds like no one is sure if that's what they used, and if so why)?

Thanks for the discussion! I get the same error for [rsa and ecdsa test keys](https://github.com/secure-systems-lab/securesystemslib/commit/7952c3fae40fdf6012a952902e17dc6ca242dc9c), which I created with LibreSSL 3.3.6, which still seems to be the default openssl on macOS. 


Here's a reproducer:

```bash
$ /usr/bin/openssl version
LibreSSL 3.3.6
$ /usr/bin/openssl genrsa 2048 | /usr/bin/openssl pkcs8 -inform PEM -topk8 -passout pass:hunter2 -out key.p8
$ python <<EOF
from cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization import load_pem_private_key
with open("key.p8", "rb") as f:
    data = f.read()
load_pem_private_key(data, b'hunter2')
EOF
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 4, in <module>
ValueError: Unknown key encryption algorithm: 1.2.840.113549.1.5.3
```

issue.title: Bump the dependencies group across 1 directory with 2 updates

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: python
labels.description: Pull requests that update Python code

repository.name: in-toto
repository.description: in-toto is a framework to protect supply chain integrity.

issue.body:
Bumps the dependencies group with 2 updates in the / directory: [cryptography](https://github.com/pyca/cryptography) and [ruff](https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff). Updates `cryptography` from 44.0.3 to 45.0.2
Changelog

Sourced from cryptography's changelog.

45.0.2 - 2025-05-17


* Fixed using ``mypy`` with ``cryptography`` on older versions of Python.

.. _v45-0-1:


45.0.1 - 2025-05-17

  • Updated Windows, macOS, and Linux wheels to be compiled with OpenSSL 3.5.0.

.. _v45-0-0:

45.0.0 - 2025-05-17 (YANKED)


* Support for Python 3.7 is deprecated and will be removed in the next
  ``cryptography`` release.
* Updated the minimum supported Rust version (MSRV) to 1.74.0, from 1.65.0.
* Added support for serialization of PKCS#12 Java truststores in
  :func:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization.pkcs12.serialize_java_truststore`
* Added :meth:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.kdf.argon2.Argon2id.derive_phc_encoded` and
  :meth:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.kdf.argon2.Argon2id.verify_phc_encoded` methods
  to support password hashing in the PHC string format
* Added support for PKCS7 decryption and encryption using AES-256 as the
  content algorithm, in addition to AES-128.
* **BACKWARDS INCOMPATIBLE:** Made SSH private key loading more consistent with
  other private key loading:
  :func:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.serialization.load_ssh_private_key`
  now raises a ``TypeError`` if the key is unencrypted but a password is
  provided (previously no exception was raised), and raises a ``TypeError`` if
  the key is encrypted but no password is provided (previously a ``ValueError``
  was raised).
* Added ``__copy__`` to the
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ec.EllipticCurvePrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ec.EllipticCurvePublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ed25519.Ed25519PublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ed25519.Ed25519PrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ed448.Ed448PublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.ed448.Ed448PrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.x25519.X25519PublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.x25519.X25519PrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.x448.X448PublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.x448.X448PrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.rsa.RSAPrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.rsa.RSAPublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.dsa.DSAPrivateKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.dsa.DSAPublicKey`,
  :class:`~cryptography.hazmat.primitives.asymmetric.dh.DHPrivateKey`, and
</tr></table>

... (truncated)

  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Updates `ruff` from 0.11.9 to 0.11.10
Release notes

Sourced from ruff's releases.

0.11.10

Release Notes

Preview features

  • [ruff] Implement a recursive check for RUF060 (#17976)
  • [airflow] Enable autofixes for AIR301 and AIR311 (#17941)
  • [airflow] Apply try catch guard to all AIR3 rules (#17887)
  • [airflow] Extend AIR311 rules (#17913)

Bug fixes

  • [flake8-bugbear] Ignore B028 if skip_file_prefixes is present (#18047)
  • [flake8-pie] Mark autofix for PIE804 as unsafe if the dictionary contains comments (#18046)
  • [flake8-simplify] Correct behavior for str.split/rsplit with maxsplit=0 (SIM905) (#18075)
  • [flake8-simplify] Fix SIM905 autofix for rsplit creating a reversed list literal (#18045)
  • [flake8-use-pathlib] Suppress diagnostics for all os.* functions that have the dir_fd parameter (PTH) (#17968)
  • [refurb] Mark autofix as safe only for number literals (FURB116) (#17692)

Rule changes

  • [flake8-bandit] Skip S608 for expressionless f-strings (#17999)
  • [flake8-pytest-style] Don't recommend usefixtures for parametrize values (PT019) (#17650)
  • [pyupgrade] Add resource.error as deprecated alias of OSError (UP024) (#17933)

CLI

Documentation

Dependabot commands and options

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore major version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's major version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's major version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore minor version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's minor version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's minor version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore ` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency (unless you unignore this specific dependency or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove the ignore condition of the specified dependency and ignore conditions

body: @lukpueh Thanks, I can reproduce this on latest macOS, but I can also reproduce it on LibreSSL 4.1.0. So I think there are two action items here. First, we'll be adding support back for this OID despite its decrepit nature. Second, we'll be reaching out to the LibreSSL folks to get them to change this default
Ok, #12956 adds a test vector, next up we'll add an implementation, after we ping the LibreSSL folks.

issue.title: Fix terrible defaults in terrible code implementing terrible standards (PKCS8, PKCS12, probably others)

repository.name: portable
repository.description: LibreSSL Portable itself. This includes the build scaffold and compatibility layer that builds portable LibreSSL from the OpenBSD source code. Pull requests or patches sent to tech@openbsd.org are welcome.

body:
I know... ([closely related][1]) We should really fix this. PKCS8 and PKCS12 are just something we don't use in the OS and I myself have only ever touched them when somebody reported a bug.

I'll happily flip the defaults to something saner but I'll have to look into what makes sense. I filed an issue that should remind me of it.

Sorry about that.

[1]: https://marc.info/?l=openbsd-tech&m=174690438827143&w=2

issue.title: fixes #12949 -- added support for decrypting des-cbc-md5 keys

repository.name: cryptography
repository.description: cryptography is a package designed to expose cryptographic primitives and recipes to Python developers.

issue.body:
Implemented by Zed (claude sonnet 4) + a bit of cleanup by me with the following prompt:

> Add support to the existing private key parsing APIs for decrypting keys that have the OID 1.2.840.113549.1.5.3. There's an existing vector you can add to our tests for this (documented in test-vectors.rst). You can run tests + formatters + linters with `nox -e local`
